sentences.en: After the liturgical celebration Fr Alliata, archaeologist of the Studium Biblicum Franciscanum, explained the archaeological remains.
sentences.cn: 礼仪庆祝之后,Alliata神父, 方济圣经书院的考古学家, 解释著这些考古遗迹.

sentences.en: He had many religious books, the kind of standard liturgical texts that were the stuff of religious enthusiasm, and more modern theological works in the Russian Orthodox tradition.
sentences.cn: 他有许多宗教书籍 大多是关于标准的礼拜仪式的,也就是一些宗教狂热的东西,还有一些俄国东正教传统中更现代的神学作品

sentences.en: He not only cares about us but has set up precise moral norms and liturgical practices that we must follow to ensure our eternal salvation.
sentences.cn: 他不但关心我们，而且设立了严格的道德规范和礼仪习俗，我们都必须加以遵守以确保获得永生的救赎。

sentences.en: He read it loudly, his hands on his ears, in a passionate voice, following a liturgical rhythm.
sentences.cn: 他按照礼拜仪式的韵律，手捂着耳朵，以充满激情的声音大声地朗读起来。

sentences.en: Latin used for liturgical purposes during the Middle Ages.
sentences.cn: 中世纪时期用做礼拜式目的的拉丁语.

sentences.en: This period corresponds with the liturgical season of Christmas.
sentences.cn: 这个时期与圣诞节的礼拜季节相一致.

words.tran_cn: 礼拜仪式；圣餐仪式；祷告文

trans.tran_en: relating to church services and ceremonies
